author: Lancelloti
description:
Get a whole month of great cinema FREE on MUBI: https://mubi.com/lancellotti

Quentin Tarantino’s Reservoir Dogs is often remembered as the ultimate indie crime thriller that changed cinema forever. But what if I told you that one of its key inspirations came from a lesser-known Hong Kong film — Ringo Lam’s City on Fire?

In this video essay, we’ll break down the origins of Reservoir Dogs, explore Tarantino’s meta-cinema, and analyze how he transformed elements of City on Fire into something entirely new. From the infamous warehouse to the tragic undercover cop story, this is a dive into homage, reinvention, and the thin line between influence and imitation.

If you’re into film history, crime movies, or just want to understand why Reservoir Dogs remains so iconic, this deep dive is for you.

#ReservoirDogs #QuentinTarantino #CityOnFire #FilmAnalysis #CrimeCinema #Tarantino #HongKongCinema #VideoEssay #IndependentFilm #MovieAnalysis
title: Did Tarantino just steal his first movie?
